text: William Theodore Link (December 15, 1933 â€“ December 27, 2020) was an American screenwriter and producer. He was born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Link was known for creating the television programs Columbo, Murder, She Wrote and Mannix. He won two Primetime Emmy Award in 1970 and 1972. Link died on December 27, 2020 in Los Angeles from heart failure at the age of 87. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American television producers Category:American television writers Category:Screenwriters from Pennsylvania Category:Writers from Philadelphia Category:American Emmy Award winners Category:Deaths from heart failure
title: William Link
